document_title: Postpartum urinary tract infection: Causes and effective treatments
subsection_name: viem-duong-tiet-nieu-sau-sinh.json_5_Treatment of urinary tract infections after giving birth
subsection_content:
In case of mild urinary tract infection
If there are signs of mild urinary tract infection, pregnant women can apply some advice such as:; Drink plenty of water to eliminate bacteria from the excretory system; Increase foods that can prevent pathogenic microorganisms from sticking to the urethral wall, such as cranberries and citrus fruits; Clean the private area properly with mild detergents; Regularly change sanitary napkins to avoid stagnant lochia; Choose cool clothes to prevent bacteria from growing; Be cautious when having sex and pay attention to cleanliness immediately afterward
Post-coital urinary tract infection is a medical condition caused by E.coli bacteria and other types of bacteria during unsafe sex, especially through the anus.
Don't be subjective because the disease can get worse quickly if not treated promptly
In case of severe urinary tract infection
When postpartum urinary tract infection becomes severe, the doctor will prescribe medication to help the mother reduce fever, pain and inflammation. The beta lactam broad-spectrum antibiotic group is quite safe and can be prescribed to pregnant women with urinary tract infections without affecting the health of mother and baby.
Normally, for uncomplicated infections, the patient will take antibiotics for 2-3 days.
In cases of severe infection, the patient may need to be treated with medication for about 14 days or more, as recommended by the doctor.
